controls.label: Systolic
controls.description:
Peak systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in systolic or contraction
                        phase of the heart cycle.

termDefinition.description:
Peak systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in systolic or contraction
                        phase of the heart cycle.

controls.label: Diastolic
controls.description:
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or
                        relaxation phase of the heart cycle.

termDefinition.description:
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or
                        relaxation phase of the heart cycle.

controls.label: Pulse pressure
controls.description: The difference between the systolic and diastolic pressure.

termDefinition.description: The difference between the systolic and diastolic pressure.

controls.label: Clinical interpretation
controls.description:
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical
                        meaning and significance of the blood pressure measurement.

termDefinition.description:
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical
                        meaning and significance of the blood pressure measurement.

controls.label: Comment
controls.description: Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.

termDefinition.description: Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.

at0000.description:
The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for
                        arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.
at0000.comment:
Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of
                        brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.

at0004.description:
Peak systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in systolic or contraction
                        phase of the heart cycle.

at0005.description:
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or
                        relaxation phase of the heart cycle.

at0006.description:
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly
                        defined in a template or at run-time.

at0008.description: The position of the individual at the time of measurement.

at0013.description: The size of the cuff used for blood pressure measurement.
at0013.comment:
Perloff D, Grim C, Flack J, Frohlich ED, Hill M, McDonald M, Morgenstern BZ.
                        Human blood pressure determination by sphygmomanometry. Circulation 1993;88;2460-2470.

at0014.description: Simple body site where blood pressure was measured.

at0015.description: A cuff used for an adult thigh.

at0016.description: A cuff for adults with larger arms.

at0017.description: A cuff that is standard for an adult.

at0025.description: The right arm of the person.

at0026.description: The left arm of the person.

at0027.description: The right thigh of the person.

at0028.description: The left thigh of the person.

at0033.description: Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.

at1000.description: Standing at the time of blood pressure measurement.

at1001.description:
Sitting (for example on bed or chair) at the time of blood pressure
                        measurement.

at1002.description: Reclining at the time of blood pressure measurement.

at1003.description: Lying flat at the time of blood pressure measurement.

at1005.description:
The craniocaudal tilt of the surface on which the person is lying at the
                        time of measurement.

at1006.description:
The average arterial pressure that occurs over the entire course of the
                        heart contraction and relaxation cycle.

at1007.description: The difference between the systolic and diastolic pressure.

at1008.description: A cuff used for a small adult.

at1009.description: A cuff that is appropriate for a child or adult with a thin arm.

at1010.description:
Record which Korotkoff sound is used for determining diastolic pressure
                        using auscultative method.

at1011.description: The fourth Korotkoff sound is identified as an abrupt muffling of sounds.

at1012.description:
The fifth Korotkoff sound is identified by absence of sounds as the cuff
                        pressure drops below the diastolic blood pressure.

at1014.description:
Lying flat with some lateral tilt, usually angled towards the left side.
                        Commonly required in the last trimester of pregnancy to relieve aortocaval compression.

at1019.description:
A cuff used for a neonate, assuming cuff is the appropriate size for
                        maturity and birthweight of the neonate.

at1020.description: The right wrist of the individual.

at1021.description: The left wrist of the individual.

at1025.description:
Details about sphygmomanometer or other device used to measure the blood
                        pressure.

at1026.description: The right ankle of the individual.

at1030.description:
Details about physical activity undertaken at the time of blood pressure
                        measurement.

at1031.description: The left ankle of the individual.

at1035.description: Method of measurement of blood pressure.

at1036.description:
Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a stethoscope and
                        Korotkoff sounds.

at1037.description:
Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using palpation (usually of
                        the brachial or radial arteries).

at1038.description:
Formula used to calculate the Mean Arterial Pressure (if recorded in
                        data).

at1039.description:
Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a blood pressure
                        machine.

at1040.description:
Method of measuring blood pressure internally ie involving penetration of
                        the skin and measuring inside blood vessels.

at1042.description: Estimate of the average blood pressure over a 24 hour period.

at1043.description:
Sleep status - supports interpretation of 24 hour ambulatory blood pressure
                        records.

at1045.description: The individual is in the natural state of bodily rest.

at1052.description:
Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to
                        the blood pressure measurement. For example, level of anxiety or 'white coat syndrome'; pain or
                        fever; changes in atmospheric pressure etc.

at1053.description: Invasive measurement via transducer access line within an artery.

at1054.description:
Formula used to calculate the systolic pressure from from mean arterial
                        pressure (if recorded in data).

at1055.description:
Formula used to calculate the diastolic pressure from mean arterial pressure
                        (if recorded in data).

at1056.description: The individual's dorsum of the foot.

at1057.description: Structured anatomical location of where the measurement was taken.

at1058.description:
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with
                        other reference models/formalisms.
at1058.comment:
For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to
                        align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

at1059.description:
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical
                        meaning and significance of the blood pressure measurement.
